entry.title: Re: WEBI auto save feature
entry.content:
I'm not sure I understand the statements...

For the 5-digit number references ID of the existing document in the CMS, meaning it is already saved.

For the digit 0, this implies that placeholder for a new unsaved document that has no CMS ID yet.

I see autosave copies of public documents with "-0" in my ~WebIntelligence folder.  This does not seem to match what you indicate in these statements.

entry.title: Re: Integrating SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis Cloud with Jenkins: A Practical Guide
entry.content:
Hi Ingo,

you can use these API calls for Tricentis Test Automation for SAP integrated with SAP Cloud ALM, as well as for SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis. These are Open APIs that you can leverage regardless of the included version with SAP Cloud ALM of Tricentis Test Automation or the version within the SAP Solution Extensions Program.

Regarding the agents, executions via SAP Cloud ALM or, in this case, via Jenkins need Team Agents to be up and running. You could include the creation of a VM and running the Team Agents within the Jenkins pipeline as well. Local Agents won't work as they only work for temporary runs of test and don't save the log files of these test runs.

https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/admin_guide/agents_team.htm

https://documentation.tricentis.com/sap/ect_cloud/en/content/glossary.htm#private_agent

entry.title: New Brazilian Tax Reform - How to prepare your SBN solution for it (English Version)
entry.content:
Portuguese Version

           Hello!

           Starting today, we will begin a series of posts about the Brazilian Tax Reform, its impact on the SAP Business Network (SBN), and related topics, focusing on the activities and potential changes that will be necessary in your integrations, configurations, and customizations in the SBN.

           Future changes related to the solution will be communicated and monitored directly via official SBN releases by our product team.

 

1. Context

           Based on the Constitutional Amendment (EC) 132/2023 and Complementary Law (LC) 214/2025, the ICMS, ISS, IPI, PIS, and COFINS will be replaced by Dual Value Added Tax (VAT). The Dual VAT will consist of:

  • IBS (Tax on Goods and Services) ‚Äì state and municipal competence, replacing ICMS and ISS
  • CBS (Contribution on Goods and Services) ‚Äì federal competence, replacing PIS, COFINS and IPI

           The Selective Tax (IS) will also be created, which will be of federal competence and will apply to goods considered harmful to health or the environment, such as cigarettes and alcoholic beverages.

           Additionally, along with the tax changes, there will be a change in the composition of the CNPJ, which will become alphanumeric.

           According to the government publications, the change will be progressive, occurring gradually from 2026 to 2033.

 

2. Changes in SAP ERP

           SAP is working to meet all new requirements in advance and periodically publishing notes for system preparation. Information and links are available through two channels:

  • Regulatory Change Manager page dedicated to the topic 
  • Notes in detail and conversations with experts in the Workzone

Note: The page is authorized to the external public, but it is necessary to register and request access.

 

3. Changes in SAP Business Network for Buyer Companies

           If your company uses SAP Business Network as a buyer to transact with your suppliers, pay attention to the necessary changes highlighted below. Some definitions and actions must be taken directly by the buyer customers. See below:

 

3.1 Sending and Receiving Documents in ERP:

  • Initially, the buyer customer must define how it will handle the new taxes in the ERP, whether to update the current VATs, or to create new codes. 
  • It is also necessary to analyze if there are any developments related to relevant fields (CNPJ and taxes) for the enrichment of files (idocs, proxys, etc.) sent and received from SAP Business Network. If so, the customer must review the customizations made to ensure they will not be affected by the change in CNPJ format and the new taxes.

 

3.2 Customized Mappings:

  • The customer must review the custom mappings, if any, from sending and receiving documents. The goal is also to ensure that no impacts occur.

           Example of custom mapping for CNPJ: in this case, the customer sends the CNPJ in only one field in the idoc. In the mapping, the number is sent to various fields within the cmxl, such as ShipTo. An analysis must be realized to ensure that alphanumeric CNPJ will not affect the customization performed.

           Example of customized mapping for taxes: the standard segment for sending taxes is E1EDP01/E1EDP04. In this case, the customer sends the taxes in segment E1EDP05 and has a custom mapping to migrates the information. See the comparison:

            Standard ‚Äì Sending taxes in the segment E1EDP01/E1EDP04, there is no need for customization in CIG:

           Current Taxes:

                     E1EDP04 SEGMENT="1">
                           <MWSKZ>IPI</MWSKZ>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                           <MWSBT>0.00</MWSBT>
                           <TXJCD>MG</TXJCD>
                           <KTEXT>IPI Non-Deductible</KTEXT>
                     </E1EDP04>
                     <E1EDP04 SEGMENT="1">
                           <MWSKZ>ICMS</MWSKZ>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                           <MWSBT>0.00</MWSBT>
                           <TXJCD>MG</TXJCD>
                           <KTEXT>ICMS Non-Deductible</KTEXT>
                     </E1EDP04>

           Estimated idoc with new taxes:

                     <E1EDP04 SEGMENT="1">
                           <MWSKZ>CBS</MWSKZ>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                           <MWSBT>0.00</MWSBT>
                           <TXJCD>MG</TXJCD>
                           <KTEXT>CBS</KTEXT>
                     </E1EDP04>
                     <E1EDP04 SEGMENT="1">
                           <MWSKZ>IBS</MWSKZ>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                           <MWSBT>0.00</MWSBT>
                           <TXJCD>MG</TXJCD>
                           <KTEXT>IBS</KTEXT>
                     </E1EDP04>

           Customized ‚Äì Sending taxes in the segment E1EDP01/E1EDP05, customization in CIG is needed.

           Current Taxes:

                     <E1EDP05 SEGMENT="1">
                           <KOTXT>IPI</KOTXT>
                           <KRATE>0.00</KRATE>
                           <KOBTR>0.00</KOBTR>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                     </E1EDP05>
                     <E1EDP05 SEGMENT="1">
                           <KOTXT>ICMS</KOTXT>
                           <KRATE>0.00</KRATE>
                           <KOBTR>0.00</KOBTR>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                     </E1EDP05>

 

           Estimated idoc with new taxes:

                     <E1EDP05 SEGMENT="1">
                           <KOTXT>CBS</KOTXT>
                           <KRATE>0.00</KRATE>
                           <KOBTR>0.00</KOBTR>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                     </E1EDP05>
                     <E1EDP05 SEGMENT="1">
                           <KOTXT>IBS</KOTXT>
                           <KRATE>0.00</KRATE>
                           <KOBTR>0.00</KOBTR>
                           <MSATZ>0.00</MSATZ>
                     </E1EDP05>

 

3.3 SBN Customization and Configuration:

  • Check in the project documentation if customizations were made on the SAP Business Network templates or in relevant fields for CNPJs and taxes. If so, contact your SAP account manager, as screen customizations are only customized by the SAP team.
  • If you have a customized tax list, review the list of taxes registered in the transaction rule ‚ÄúRequire suppliers to choose from your list of valid tax values ‚Äù within the ‚ÄúDefault Transaction Rules ‚Äù option.

Account Settings / Manage Profile / Default Transaction Rules / Require suppliers to choose from your list of valid tax values / Configure

 

  • The supplier customer who has SAP Business Network integration with the ERP must review their mappings and data transformation, ensuring that they are prepared to receive the new tax ID formats and new taxes (more information about this activity will be disclosed soon).

 

4. Changes in SAP Business Network for Supplier Companies

           If your company uses SAP Business Network as a supplier to transact with your buyers and has the platform integrated with your ERP, pay attention to the need for adjustments in data sending and receiving. We will soon release news detailing what potential adjustments your IT team or SAP partner should make.

 

Questions?

                If you have any questions, contact your SAP account manager to request specific help and review your solution.

entry.title: Re: Rework return to first activity in routing
entry.content:
Hi, 

If all resources are marked as process resources, any user must be able to complete as described in SAP Help. Otherwise, you might want to raise a ticket to investigate what is wrong.

You can have a specific POD to pull resources into the 'special' buffer operation, so if running normal operations in normal POD, start would start the next operation. If using 'special' operation POD, then Start button would have the PPD to sign off before starting, as you described is what you are looking for. Physically, normal POD would be used in the normal resource station, and the special POD would be used in the special resource station to pull SFCs to the buffer.

You can evaluate using DM Special Operation Activity capability, instead of adding the extra buffer 'special' operation into your original routing. See Pulling an SFC into a Special Operation Activity

Br, Manoel

entry.title: Re: GIS and SAP Integration ‚Äì critical for Oil and Gas Companies
entry.content: Hello Satheesh, the VertiGIS Integrator is a standalone, message-based middleware between SAP and GIS. We have various endpoints available, such as SOAP, REST, ODATA, but also RFC calls or IDOC.

entry.title: PO printing not considering the header text updates.
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Good day!!

Seams like this information not relevant to issue please find the following below pin points for analysis.

Standard document type NB:

In the Standard document type, updates to the PO header text are triggered automatically. This means that if we change any header text and save the PO, the updated text will appear in the output message printout.

In document type(ZMAP) MAPO case :

1.In the MAPO document type, updates to the PO header text are not triggered automatically. This means that if we change any header text and save the PO, the updated text will not appear in the output message printout.

2.We tried adding the output to the messages manually to print the updated text, but the PO print form is still not generating with the updates. 

 

Regards,

Sai.

entry.title: Understanding the impact offer approvals in your hiring process
entry.content:
In this article we will confirm the requirements for offer approvals in certain hiring processes with SuccessFactors Recruitment, Onboarding and Employee Central.

Recruitment to Manage Pending Hires to Employee Central

The offer approval is mandatory for this process, if you do not have an offer approval, they will not appear in Manage Pending Hires.

Recruitment to Onboarding to Manage Pending Hires to Employee Central

The offer approval is not mandatory for this process. 

However, if your internal hire onboarding process is as follows,  Recruitment to Manage Pending Hires to Employee Central to Onboarding.  Then you will need to have an offer approval.

entry.title: Latency Issue between Update/Create Entity & Get Entity Set
entry.content:
Solved!  I needed to add BYPASSING BUFFER when reading the user's parameter id information to get the proper values.

I am working with multiple application server environment. 

When a call to Update Entity or Create Entity is performed to change the user's warehouse, I want to call Get Entity Set to refresh the material master data in the Offline Datastore.   I noticed that the data is pulling from the old value. 

When in debug mode I can see that my parameter values are updated in the database when doing the Update Entity call.  Then OnSuccess I am calling to Download Offline Data, I see that when the call is in a different application server and when reading the plant PID to know which materials to download it is returning the old plant PID value.

This seems to occur only during high traffic times of the day.  Is there something in the MDK that we can do to ensure the 2 calls use the same session?  

Other than performing recursive calls on the Download of data until we see the correct Plant information, what other options are there to ensure the correct data is returned?

entry.title: Re: PO printing not considering the header text updates.
entry.content:
Below could be the root causes

1. Output Determination Not Triggering on Header Text Change

SAP uses change pointers and field relevance settings to determine whether a change should trigger a new output. If header text fields are not marked as relevant for output, the system won‚Äôt regenerate the message.

2. Custom Document Type May Lack Proper Configuration

ZMAP may not inherit all the output determination settings from NB. It may also bypass standard BADI logic or enhancement points.

Recommended steps

Step 1: Check Output Relevance for Header Text

Go to SPRO ‚Üí Materials Management ‚Üí Purchasing ‚Üí Messages ‚Üí Field Relevant to Printouts of Changes. Ensure that header text fields (e.g., EKKO-TEXT) are marked as relevant for output. Assign appropriate text IDs

Step 2: Review Output Type Configuration

Go to NACE Application: EF, Output Type: NEU (or your custom output type). There, check for Access sequence, Condition records and Change message indicator

Step 3: Compare NB vs ZMAP Configuration

Use transaction OMEC or OMED to compare the Field selection, Message schema and Text determination procedures

Step 4: Debug BADI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST

This BADI controls PO processing and output triggering. Check method POST and PROCESS_HEADER and ensure your ZMAP document type is not by passing the logic that triggers output regeneration

entry.title: Re: PDF form of Invoice created through transaction code...
entry.content:
The FB70 app (Create Outgoing Invoices) does not support direct printing of invoices. Instead, you must use the Manage Customer Line Items app to generate a PDF via correspondence.

Below are the step-by-step guide

Step 1: Post the Invoice via FB70
Use the Create Outgoing Invoices app and post the invoice

Step 2: Open ‚ÄúManage Customer Line Items‚Äù App
Go to the Fiori Launchpad. Open Manage Customer Line Items. Filter by Company Code, Customer, Document Date or Number

Step 3: Select the Posted Invoice
Locate the invoice you posted and select the line item

Step 4: Click ‚ÄúCreate Correspondence‚Äù
Choose Create Correspondence from the toolbar. Select Document Type: e.g., Invoice. Confirm and generate

Step 5: Download the PDF
The system generates a PDF invoice. You can download or print it directly from the correspondence viewer

Check this SAP Help documentation

entry.title: Re: Flexible workflow for release settlement document
entry.content:
Problem 1: ‚ÄúNo scenarios available‚Äù in App F3681

This usually happens when:

  • The workflow scenario hasn‚Äôt been activated in SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC) or Manage Your Solution
  • The business object linkage is missing
  • The document type isn‚Äôt configured to trigger events

Try with the below steps

Activate Workflow Scenario via CBC or Manage Your Solution. Navigate to Application Area ‚Üí Sourcing and Procurement ‚Üí Settlement Management ‚Üí Workflow for Settlement Documents. Ensure the scenario is activated

Enable Event Linkage via transaction SWE2 (if available in your system), Create linkage for Object Type: BUS2100002 (Settlement Document), Event: TOBEAPPROVED, Receiver Type: WS20000691, Receiver FM: SWW_WI_CREATE_VIA_EVENT_IBF and activate linkage

Check Document Type Settings via transaction WLFA. For your settlement document type, enable ‚ÄúControl of Event Call-Up‚Äù under Special Processes

Problem 2: No Edit Option in Workflow Builder

This typically occurs when:

  • The workflow template is not assigned to a scenario
  • The agent assignment is missing
  • You don‚Äôt have the required authorization

Try with the below steps

Assign Agents to Workflow Steps via transaction SWDD, Open workflow WS20000691, For each step click Agent Assignment, Set as General Task (for testing). Assign a user or role

Enable Edit Mode via SWDD, select the workflow step, Click Change and assign Workflow Initiator or a specific role as agent.

After changes, click Update Index. Save and activate the workflow

Check this blog blog by @tatianacoelho

entry.title: Re: Rework return to first activity in routing
entry.content:
'too many entry steps' error is caused by linking your TAKEOUT operation 30 to ST010 operation 10, if you remove/skip that link you should be able to save it.

I don¬¥t have as much details as I would need to understand your current implementation, but to fulfill your requirements of moving WIP SFCs from the production line to a buffer, I would definitely use a Special Operation Activity and the process described at https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/execution/pulling-sfc-into-special-operation-activity and showed in detail in my blog https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-blog-posts-by-sap/bring-done-sfcs-back-to-work/ba-p/13923872, but for a slightly different context, so you would need to adapt.

This would allow you to move WIP SFCs to a buffer Special Operation in a different Resource, and later on return it to any activity. I just gave it a try, see details below.

Create a Special Operation: BUFFER

Which creates a Special Routing BUFFER automatically, just edit it and add Return and select 'Return to Any Activity'

Take an Active SFC at Resource Z_ASM1

User A Manoel moves it to BUFFER by Starting it at Special Operation BUFFER and a different Resource

User B CTIMES completes the Special Operation, taking SFC out of the BUFFER and returning it to any operation

Hope it helps, Manoel

entry.title: Re: SAC Story - Dropdown for property of Date dimension.
entry.content:
@antonclv19 

I am not sure of your exact requirement but it seems you want to create a dropdown with Year month values like 202501.....202512 and then based on drop down selection you want to filter the table.

Create 3 Script variable of type string as below. DD_Month and DD_Year , set them array

Now create 2 dropdowns, one for year and other for CALMONTH. So if you select 2025 in Year the other dropdown will show 202501 to 202512 and if you select 2026 it will show 202601 to 202612.

Keep the setting as below

// Define the year and the number of months.
var year =Sel_Year ;
var totalMonths = 12;

// Initialize DD_Month variable with an empty array.
 DD_Month = [''];

// Loop through each month from 1 to 12.
for (var month = 1; month <= totalMonths; month++) {
  // Pad the month number with a leading zero if it's a single digit.
  // This ensures the format is always MM (e.g., 01, 02, ..., 12).
  if(month<10)
	  {
		var yearMonthString = Sel_Year+"0"+month.toString();
	  }
else
			  {
				yearMonthString = Sel_Year+month.toString();  
			  }
			  
    

  // Convert the string to a number and push it into the DD_Month array.
  DD_Month.push(yearMonthString);
}

Since your calmonth drop down is bind to DD_Month it will show the values in that array variable a shown below. Now you can use the dropdown the way you need.

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Can Joule AI Make SAP Readiness Check & Process Insights Smarter?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm Tommy, an intern at SAP. As part of my internship, I‚Äôve been given the research topic:

                  "How to utilise Joule to interpret SAP tools such as Readiness Check and Signavio Process Insights"

After discussions with the original topic proposer, I‚Äôve refined this to:

                    "Leveraging Joule AI for immediate, context-aware interpretation of SAP tools such as Readiness Check and Process                                  Insights outputs through integrated or standalone models."

Current ideas under exploration:

Potential role of AI (Joule):

                     Integrated approach ‚Äì Joule embedded directly in tools for live Q&A and guidance.

                     Standalone approach ‚Äì Central Joule portal where exported tool data is uploaded for AI-generated summaries.

Industry & process-specific insights:

                     Could Joule be trained using Signavio Process Explorer as a knowledge source?

Customer-specific process learning:

                     Could Joule learn a customer‚Äôs business processes over time to adjust tool benchmark thresholds?

                     For example, if a process is flagged as problematic by a benchmark but is actually fine for a specific customer, could                                 Joule adapt to avoid false alarms?

I‚Äôm not looking to start a conversation and see if this direction aligns with others‚Äô perspectives and see if anyone has experience in the topic.

Would love to hear your thoughts!

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Print Manager (CPM) and SAP RISE
entry.content:
Hi @ADO 

Your interpretation is mostly correct regarding SAP Cloud Print Manager usage with RISE. The SAP note 3420465 describes differences and setups for CPM between cloud and on-premise SAP S/4HANA systems, and the document outlines how CPM can also be enabled in on-premise environments from 2024 onward.

Regarding your question about multiple locations, yes It is possible to install a separate CPM instance at each physical location where you have printers. These multiple CPM instances can connect to a single RISE system, enabling distributed printing management tailored to each site's local printers. This distributed CPM deployment approach is recommended to handle location-specific printer access and networking efficiently.

In summary, you can have 1-to-n CPMs connected to a single RISE system, each handling their local print infrastructure. This provides flexibility for multi-site organizations like yours.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Issue with Form Language in Billing Document Output I...
entry.content:
Hello @Ayman101 ,

From the screenshot, your OPD‚ÄìForm Template step has Form Language set to FR (French) for both entries. That means the language setting itself is correct, but if your output still appears in Spanish, the likely issue is below,

  • The determination step isn‚Äôt being triggered for the billing document in question.
  • Another OPD condition of higher priority might be triggered first.
  • Or the Bill-to Party language is becoming dominant because no matching OPD rule is found for the actual document key fields such as Sales Org, Document Type, and Country.

Recommended next step to confirm:

  • In Maintain Output Parameter Determination, use the simulation/test function for the billing document number.
  • This will show exactly which OPD rule is being applied and whether it‚Äôs your French one.

Video Tutorial: How to Configure Output Parameter Determination for Billing Documents

Outgoing Payment Advices: FAQ 

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Description information for Signavio synchronized sol...
entry.content:
Hi @ThomasMetzger 

Please note that in SAP Cloud ALM, the "Description" field under Solution Process Flow for processes synchronized from Signavio will only display text if the corresponding description is maintained in Signavio before synchronization.

To ensure this works, I suggest you consider the following:

  • Log-on and open the relevant process model in Signavio.
  • Then proceed to enter the desired text in the Description property of the process or the relevant BPMN element.
  • Ensure to save the model and synchronize it with SAP Cloud ALM.

If no description is maintained in Signavio, Cloud ALM will show ‚ÄúNo description is defined.‚Äù after synchronization.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Missing Create external document(URL) button in GOS o...
entry.content:
Hello @nagao_masahiro_ 

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud, the Create external document (URL) GOS option from on-premises is not included and cannot be activated. Public Cloud only provides approved GOS functions like Create Attachment and Create Note due to security and governance restrictions.

There is no SGOS customising in Public Cloud, so external URLs must be managed through permitted attachment methods or SAP Document Management Service.

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Attachments in S/4HANA Cloud

Third-Party Repository Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud

2787596 - Generic Object Services (GOS) functionality and EAM Fiori / Web Dynpro Apps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: VAT number is not populating in the invoice VBRK-STCEG
entry.content:
Hello @aravindrawat 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, rule D in VAT registration number determination uses the VAT number from the Sold-to Party.

Your VAT is only registered at the Ship-to Party, so VBRK-STCEG remains blank.
To resolve this, either:

  • Add the VAT number to the Sold-to Party BP, or change the determination rule to use the Ship-to Party.

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì VAT Registration Number Determination in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if you need further assistance

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Latency Issue between Update/Create Entity & Get Enti...
entry.content:
Hi @DonnaA 

Thank you for your message.

Regarding the issue with outdated plant PID values after Update/Create Entity calls in our multiple application server environment, the root cause is likely session inconsistency between calls, especially under high traffic. MDK doesn‚Äôt have a built‚Äëin way to force subsequent calls to use the same server session, but here are some recommended approaches:

First, configure session stickiness or affinity on the load balancer so sequential calls from the same session go to the same app server.

Then continue using BYPASSING BUFFER or similar cache bypass methods to ensure fresh reads.

Thereafter you can trigger the offline data download only after the backend transaction is fully committed and visible in the database.

Ensure to manage caching and buffering carefully at all layers.

Finally, optimize the offline store sync process and include checks to confirm the data reflects the latest updates before download.

These steps can help prevent having to rely on repeated retries while ensuring your data refresh reflects the correct, current values.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Signavio Single Sign-On Functions
entry.content:
Hi @Navigator1 

Thank you for your question

Based on the information you provided, here is the clarification on your questions regarding SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub with SSO:

Regarding License Assignment via SSO

  • Licenses are not automatically assigned just by accessing via SSO. They must be assigned in Signavio‚Äôs user management.
  • Licenses are per user or session and are released when the user logs off.
  • A single license cannot be used for multiple simultaneous sessions.

Regarding Access Profile Control with SAML/SSO

  • Users must be created or provisioned in Signavio and given roles or privileges. SSO will not automatically assign ‚ÄúViewer HUB only‚Äù or other roles.
  • For additional modules such as Process Manager, Process Intelligence, etc., user access and privileges must be manually updated in each module.

To summarize, SSO authenticates users but does not automate license assignment or role provisioning. All access rights and licenses need to be managed explicitly in the platform‚Äôs user administration.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Web Dynpro adaptions - Tier 1 or Tier 3
entry.content:
Hi @RajendraP 

In general, changes to Web Dynpro application code are considered Tier 3 changes.

To evaluate your specific case:

Adding a field using Component Configuration (purely configuration, no coding) is classified as Tier 1 adaptation.

Any modifications involving coding or extending the Web Dynpro component logic would fall under Tier 3.

Summary:

Code changes --> Tier 3

Configuration via Component Configuration --> Tier 1 adaptation

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: New Features and Fixes: Share Buttons, Notifications Feed, and More
entry.content:
@Jelena_PerfiljevaI was honestly afraid of getting this kind of answer.

Regardless of the reasons, my intention here is not to debate political arguments. I‚Äôm sure there are political factors involved, and I could list reasons why X is still relevant, along with examples of Elon Musk‚Äôs actions that have benefited its users.

However, I will assume that the addition of "Bluesky sharing" was not simply intended as a corporate sanction against X or Elon Musk.

Let‚Äôs focus on the feedback linked in the announcement. It doesn‚Äôt seem like anyone explicitly asked for ‚ÄúBluesky.‚Äù In fact, the suggestion mentioned ‚ÄúLinkedIn or X.‚Äù

 

Personally, the share button is just a convenience. I‚Äôve lost count of how many times I copied a link from my browser and shared it elsewhere (like WhatsApp) simply because it was easier. I might use it more often if it allowed sharing to multiple platforms.

On WordPress (which, as far as I know, is no longer the content management system for SAP Community), adding a share button with configurable options for different social networks is straightforward.

Facebook, X, LinkedIn, YouTube, WhatsApp, Instagram, TikTok, Telegram, Bluesky, Reddit, Slack, Discord‚Äîjust to name some popular platforms in Europe and the Americas. I‚Äôm sure there are many other relevant ones in Asia.

So why not add them all and let users decide where they want to share SAP content? If some aren‚Äôt being used, they can be removed later.

If there are strong reasons for avoiding X, I would expect SAP to make that position clear‚Äîperhaps by shutting down the SAP Community profile there (which has over 100,000 followers compared to only 432 on Bluesky).

Again, I have nothing against Bluesky, but the SAP Community presence there is clearly minimal in numbers. I‚Äôd bet there‚Äôs more SAP-related content being shared on Reddit‚Äîprobably even more than on SAP Community itself. 

Meanwhile, the low-quality SAP content I often see on LinkedIn (including posts from some recently nominated SAP Champions) should be far more concerning to SAP than any actions by Elon Musk. Of course, this is just my opinion, and I‚Äôm not trying to start another debate. Still, everyone knows LinkedIn belongs to one of SAP‚Äôs most important partners‚ÄîMicrosoft‚Äîand the poor SAP content on LinkedIn is certainly not Microsoft‚Äôs fault.

entry.title: Re: Master Data Integration - Cloud Foundry Runtime / Spa...
entry.content:
Hi @JaySchwendemann 

In SAP Master Data Integration, the naming convention for service instances can vary by scenario. The scenarios determine the integration success.

For the General ‚Äúvanilla‚Äù guidance: No spaces in instance names, runtime ‚Äúother.‚Äù

For a Scenario-specific guidance e.g., Digital Manufacturing or Business Process Orchestration, it may require or recommend using spaces in instance names.

If you start with instances without spaces, you can still onboard BPO later by creating additional instances with spaces as required. This won‚Äôt impact any other earlier deployments you may have carried out.

I recommend you follow the naming convention for your current scenario but be aware of future needs and plan accordingly to ensure smooth integration.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Create a Master Data Integration Instance

Naming Conventions

Configuring the SAP Master Data Integration Service Instance in SAP Ariba Solutions

entry.title: Re: How to find the segment i need to map in IDOC if I ha...
entry.content:
Hi @dineshhome1361_7 

If you know you need to map a specific field such as Estimated Arrival Date, I suggest you follow correct IDOC segment that describes the steps. Here are my recommendations:

  • First, ensure you identify the relevant IDOC type for your business process.
  • Then use WE60 IDOC documentation to review the IDOC structure and segments, or WE31 to view detailed segment field lists.
  • Furthermore, check functional specs or process documentation to see which segment holds date-related fields for example E1EDK14/E1EDT14 for deliveries.
  • Follow that up by reviewing test or sample IDOCs in WE19 to confirm the actual field location.
  • Finally, make sure to map the source field to that identified segment and field in your integration.

These steps will help ensure you map the field to the correct segment within the IDOC structure.

 

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Customizing Extraction Fields in SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX)
entry.content:
Hello, 

I‚Äôm currently evaluating SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX) in SAP Document AI using a trial account. Although I‚Äôve noticed that it extracts every text very accurately, not every text is being mapped to the extraction fields.
 
I wanted to add/customize header fields myself to map the extracted text to header fields or line items better (while following this link https://help.sap.com/docs/document-ai/sap-document-ai/add-data-fields to add data fields) but schema configuration doesn‚Äôt appear in my trial environment. It also states that I cannot change SAP schemas as shown in the attached image below:

So I was wondering if it's possible to edit/customize extraction fields in the premium version of SAP Document AI? If so, does this customization occur before the optical character recognition (OCR) to guide the model, or only after OCR to map extracted text to fields?
 
Defining custom field mappings before OCR would be extremely valuable for my team's use case, so I‚Äôd greatly appreciate if anyone can explain what‚Äôs possible before I consider upgrading to a full subscription. Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Missing Migration Objects in Treasury ‚Äì Any Solutions...
entry.content:
Hello @Robert136 

Thank you for your question

The available migration objects in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (release 2508) are limited by the standard Migration Cockpit, which currently offers only a limited set of predefined objects for Treasury & Risk Management.

The following objects are not included as standard migration templates,

  • Business Partner ‚Äì Counterparty role
  • Loan Facility
  • Loan-to-Facility Assignment
  • Investments

Since these objects are not part of the SAP-provided migration content, they cannot be imported using the standard migration templates in S4HANA Public Cloud. SAP‚Äôs current Roadmap Explorer and Cloud Feature Delivery (CFD) do not list them for upcoming releases.

Recommended Approach:

  1. Use Existing Migration Objects Where Possible;-Migrate the core Business Partner records and add roles where necessary
  2. Leverage Released APIs:-For supported entities, utilise OData APIs from SAP API Business Hub to load data programmatically.
  3. Automation for Non-API Scenarios:-For entities without APIs, utilise SAP Build Process Automation or similar RPA tools to simulate mass creation.

It is advisable to split the migration into these workstreams to minimise manual input and accelerate processing, especially considering the volume of records involved.

Let me know if it works

Kind regards,
Chuma

Check below SAP

References:

  • SAP API Business Hub ‚Äì Treasury APIs
  • SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Data Migration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
